intro: Drakonorchis, commonly known as the dragon orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia and the Philippines. Drakonorchis species are characterized by their striking, often colorful flowers that resemble dragons, hence their common name. They typically grow as epiphytes or lithophytes, attaching themselves to trees or rocks in humid environments. The botanical features of Drakonorchis include long, slender stems and intricate, showy blooms that attract specific pollinators.
